Field Label:
Background: The World Health Organization categorizes cause of death in two ways:

Immediate Cause of Death: Defined as the terminal diagnosis resulting in death (e.g. hypoxemia or respiratory arrest as immediate cause of death based upon and underlying cause of death of pneumonia).

Underlying Cause of Death: Defined as the disease or injury that initiated the events that resulted in presentation to a health facility and death (e.g. pneumonia, diarrheal disease, motor vehicle collision)

Changing incidence of an underlying cause of death or care seeking behaviors can result in change in child mortality, while addressing the immediate cause(s) of death may change management of hospitalized children and improve quality of care. However, efforts to decrease child mortality and to evaluate differences in mortality rates between children HIV-exposed uninfected and children HIV-unexposed requires an understanding of differences between in the underlying cause(s) of death between the two groups, if any.
Using the instructions listed above, please select the underlying cause(s) of death (not immediate cause of death), ranking by primary cause, secondary cause, tertiary, etc:
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 1, Anemia | 2, Asthma | 3, Bronchiolitis | 4, Cancer | 5, Congenital Anomalies/Birth Defects | 6, Congestive Cardiac Failure | 7, Croup | 8, Diabetes | 9, Diarrheal Disease | 10, Epilepsy | 11, Gastroenteritis (Both vomiting and diarrhea) | 12, HIV infection | 13, Injury (Accidental or intentional, including animal bite, fall, insect bite/sting, motor collision, physical abuse, poisoning/accidental ingestion, etc) | 14, Kidney Disease | 15, Liver Disease | 16, Malaria | 17, Malnutrition | 18, Measles | 19, Meningitis | 20, Pneumonia | 21, Poisoning/Accidental Ingestion | 22, Sepsis | 23, Sickle Cell Disease | 24, Tuberculosis | 25, Upper Respiratory Tract Infection | 26, Other

Field Label: Specify other underlying cause(s) of death

Section Header: Please rank the causes of death selected above. Note that if multiple underlying causes of death have been selected, each selection must have a different number.

Field Label: Injury (Accidental or intentional, including animal bite, fall, insect bite, motor collision, physical abuse, etc.)
If further descriptive detail about the cause of death is deemed to add more information, please provide text here:

Field Label: Who made the decision on cause of death?
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 1, An adjudication panel blinded to the child's HIV exposure status | 2, A clinician blinded to the child's HIV exposure status | 3, A clinician not blinded to the child's HIV exposure status | 4, A research associate conducting medical chart abstraction | 5, Other (Specify) | 6, Unknown

Field Label: It is indicated that the cause of death was a congenital anomaly or birth defect. Listed below are the most common type of congenital anomalies or birth defects that are associated with death in children up to age 5. Please indicate the type of congenital anomaly or birth defect that resulted in this child's death. You may select more than one.
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 1, Atrioventricular Septal Defect (Congenital Heart Disease) | 2, Common Arterial Trunk (Persistent Truncus Arteriosus Congenital Heart Disease) | 3, Diaphragmatic Hernia | 4, Hydrocephalus (Nervous System Congenital Anomaly) | 5, Omphalocele | 6, Single Ventricle/Hypoplastic Left Heart (Congenital Heart Disease) | 7, Skeletal Dysplasia | 8, Spina Bifida (Neural tube defect) | 9, Tetralogy of Fallot (Congenital Heart Disease) | 10, Transposition of the Great Vessels (Congenital Heart Disease) | 11, Tricuspid Atresia/Stenosis (Congenital Heart Disease) | 12, Ventral Septal Defect (Congenital Heart Disease) | 13, Other (Specify) | 99, Unknown
